title: geocorr-api R Package
text: R package provides simplified programmatic access geographic crosswalks geocorr2022 website (https://mcdc.missouri.edu/applications/geocorr2022.html). allows users obtain geographic correspondence tables different geographic units (e.g., census tracts ZIP codes, counties congressional districts) without manually using web interface.

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: Simplified programmatic access geocorr2022 geographic crosswalks Support various geographic unit combinations Automated data retrieval processing Always returns crosswalks 50 states (state subsetting) Consistent data frame output format complex filtering options - focuses core crosswalk functionality

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: Use tools rvest package dynamically interact geocorr22 website submit request crosswalk Use tools rvest package download requested website available geocorr22 Standardize returned crosswalk users always returned crosswalk column names, regardless geographies crosswalked Simplify geocorr2022 interface removing complex options always requesting nationwide data

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: state selection: Always returns crosswalks 50 states Single output format: Always returns R data frame (CSV, HTML, PDF options) geographic filters: Removes optional county codes, metro area codes, filtering options Core functionality : Focuses essential crosswalk generation without advanced customization

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: Follow R package development best practices Use roxygen2 documentation Include comprehensive examples function documentation Ensure proper error handling API interactions Write unit tests public functions Consider rate limiting web requests

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: Run devtools::test() execute unit tests Use devtools::check() submitting changes Test various geographic unit combinations

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: Tidyverse packages: dplyr, stringr, purrr, tibble API packages: httr2, jsonlite Web scraping: rvest Development tools: devtools, testthat, roxygen2

title: geocorr-api R Package
text: Always prefer tidyverse packages base R equivalents Use stringr functions instead base R string functions (never use grepl, gsub, regexpr, etc.) Use dplyr data manipulation instead base R Use purrr functional programming instead apply family functions Use tibble instead data.frame possible Follow tidyverse style conventions pipe operators

what: Simple interface to inter-temporal and inter-geography crosswalks
title: Simple interface to inter-temporal and inter-geography crosswalks
text: R interface inter-geography inter-temporal crosswalks.

title: Simple interface to inter-temporal and inter-geography crosswalks
text: project provides consistent API standardized versions crosswalks allow programmatic interpolation time geographies. Say goodbye manual crosswalk downloads hello reproducible workflows.

title: Simple interface to inter-temporal and inter-geography crosswalks
Simple interface to inter-temporal and inter-geography crosswalks
text: get started library(crosswalk):
code: # Load the package library(crosswalk)  ## obtain a crosswalk to translate data in 2020-vintage place geographies ## to 2020-vintage county geographies, weighted by population place_county_crosswalk = get_geocorr_crosswalk(   source_geography = "place",   target_geography = "county",   weight = c("population"),   cache = here::here("data"))  ## obtain a crosswalk to translate data in 2000-vintage place geographies ## to 2010-vintage place geographies. all available weighting options are ## returned get_nhgis_crosswalk(   source_year = 2000,   source_geography = "place",   target_year = 2010,   target_geography = place,   download_directory = here::here("data"),   use_cache = TRUE)

title: Simple interface to inter-temporal and inter-geography crosswalks
text: Crosswalks critical component conducting social sciences research enable analysts translate data one geography /temporal vintage another. example, source data available county level, crosswalk can help produce estimates source data city level, enabling analysis geography (city) may either relevant target audience(s) /may align geography data form part overarching analysis. excellent existing resources crosswalks, including University Missouri - Missouri Census Data Center’s Geocorr 2022 crosswalking application IPUMS National Historical Geographic Information System (NHGIS). fact, crosswalks returned using library(crosswalk) Geocorr NHGIS. use package ? provides: consistent, programmatic approach acquire crosswalks, rather ad-hoc manual downloads; Standardized clear crosswalk variable names can easily work multiple crosswalks using workflow; Crosswalk metadata stored within returned crosswalk–commenting script 15 options configured prior clicking “Download”; ability easily “cache” crosswalks locally. brief: package facilitates well documented reproducible analysis workflow, building top robust underlying resources already available crosswalking.

what: Get an Inter-temporal or Inter-geography Crosswalk — get_crosswalk
title: Get an Inter-temporal or Inter-geography Crosswalk — get_crosswalk
text: Retrieves crosswalk interpolation values source geography target geography, desired, source year target year.

title: Get an Inter-temporal or Inter-geography Crosswalk — get_crosswalk
code: get_crosswalk(   source_geography,   target_geography,   source_year = NULL,   target_year = NULL,   cache = NULL,   weight = NULL )

title: Get an Inter-temporal or Inter-geography Crosswalk — get_crosswalk
text: source_geography Character. Source geography name. One c("block", "block group", "tract"). target_geography Character. Target geography name. One c("block", "block group", "tract", "place", county", "urban_area", "zcta", "puma", "core_based_statistical_area"). source_year Character numeric. Year source geography one c(1990, 2000, 2010, 2020). target_year Character numeric. Year target geography, one c(1990, 2000, 2010, 2020). cache File path. download crosswalk . NULL (default), crosswalk returned saved disk.

title: Get an Inter-temporal or Inter-geography Crosswalk — get_crosswalk
text: data frame containing crosswalk specified geographies. Data tidy-formatted, observation reflecting unique source-target-weighting factor combination. Note (typically two three) available weighting factors returned. #' @return dataframe representing requested crosswalk 51 states Puerto Rico. Depending desired geographies source crosswalk (Geocorr vs. NHGIS), fields may included. source_geoid unique identifier source geography target_geoid unique identifier target geography source_geography_name name source geography target_geography_name name target geography source_year year source geography target_year year target geography allocation_factor_source_to_target weight interpolate values source geography target geography allocation_factor_target_to_source weight interpolate values target geography source geography population_2020 estimated overlap population, applicable housing_2020 estimated overlap housing units, applicable land_area_sqmi overlap land area, applicable weighting_factor attribute used calculate allocation factors

title: Get an Inter-temporal or Inter-geography Crosswalk — get_crosswalk
text: function sources crosswalks Geocorr 2022 IPUMS NHGIS. Crosswalk weights original sources modified; function merely standardizes format returned crosswalks enables easy programmatic access cacheing. Note IPUMS NHGIS API key required access crosswalks source. Use usethis::edit_r_environ(scope = "user") save API key .Renviron; name key "IPUMS_API_KEY". can obtain key : https://account.ipums.org/api_keys.

title: List Available NHGIS Crosswalks — list_nhgis_crosswalks
text: Returns tibble available NHGIS geographic crosswalks corresponding parameters can used get_nhgis_crosswalk().

title: List Available NHGIS Crosswalks — list_nhgis_crosswalks
text: tibble columns: source_year: Year source geography source_geography: Source geography name target_year: Year target geography target_geography: Target geography name

title: Standardize Geography Names — standardize_geography
text: Internal helper function convert various geography name spellings standard codes.

title: Standardize Geography Names — standardize_geography
text: geography Character. Geography name various formats. context Character. Either "source" "target" determine valid options.

title: Standardize Geography Names — standardize_geography
text: Character. Standardized geography code.
